name: Future Inn Cardiff Bay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Future Inn, Cardiff Bay is situated on the 'wrong' side of Cardiff Bay, behind the Red Dragon Centre and overlooking the docks and the relief road, so no lovely sea views and quite difficult to find. However, it is only a four minute walk to the Millenium Centre and all the bars and restaurants of the Bay and is, despite overlooking a fast main road, extremely quiet.
reviews.title: Quiet, comfortable and convienient

reviews.text: The reception is bright and welcoming and the staff pleasant and efficient. All the rooms are a good size, most either with a queen bed and sofa plus arm chair or with two queen-sized beds. The bathroom is a reasonable size and has a shower over the bath, which gives a choice for bath-lovers. The bed was fine, though the pillows were a bit hard.
reviews.title: Clean spacious modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is nothing extra special about the Future Inn (no spa, pool, club etc), it's quite faceless really, but it has everything you could want for a stay in that part of Cardiff - the staff are all friendly and helpful; the rooms are clean, spacious and quiet; there is free parking and it is convienient. On this occasion we decided not to eat in the hotel, not having enjoyed it much on a previous visit, so we strolled down to the Bay for breakfast instead.
reviews.title: great for the rugby

reviews.text: Stayed here with a group of people attending a function in the Bay.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very pleasant professional efficient reception staff - in fact all the staff were friendly and efficient.
reviews.title: Excellent value hotel in the Bay

reviews.text: Clean bright modern rooms and very comfortable.
reviews.title: Clean biright and comfortable
General Advice on Cardiff
reviews.text: Limited free internet on the TV in the room but free WiFi in reception and bar.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast average but with few healthy options.
reviews.title: Liked it

reviews.text: Disadvantages is that my sat nav couldn't find it probably as its so new and you do feel as if its in the middle of an industrial wasteland. I think the area is undergoing regeneration so this will probably improve.
reviews.title: Fine

reviews.text: Just back (February 18th 2008) from a weekend in Cardiff where I stayed at The Future Inn, Cardiff Bay. Overall the hotel was very good, the room was spacious and spotlessly clean, with free internet and DVD/CD player. The staff were very helpful and the breakfast was good as well. Its a modern building located beside a busy roundabout, would recommend to keep the window closed though due to traffic noise. Only drawback is, its a little difficult to find, there is a lot of building work going on in the area and you have to walk through the Pizza Hut carpark to get to the hotel. Having said that a frequent bus service The Bay Car from Cardiff Bus is only 5 minutes away and the attractions of Cardiff Bay just a 10 minute walk. Its well worth the money and the best deal I found was by phoning the hotel!
reviews.title: A nice clean hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a quality hotel in Cardiff Bay with reasonably easy access to Cardiff City Centre. Reasonably, as I couldn't find a way to walk it. Taxis into Cardiff city centre are fine but getting them back at night is a nightmare. Driving into Cardiff is not recommended unless money is no object as parking charges are ridiculously high £0.80 for 15 mins!!! With this in mind the location I would have to say is OK rather than good.
reviews.title: Good quality if a little pricey

likes.liked: — Good clean rooms with reasonably good facilities

reviews.text: We stayed here whilst watching Madonna in concert and they had a Modonna buffet in the bar which was quite amusing. This date however meant that the cost of a room was £155.00 room only which I think is quite high (especially with breakfast exclued).
reviews.title: Great Location for Cardiff Bay

likes.disliked: — nothing really- the landscaping around the front could be nicer but thats a minor quibble really

reviews.text: The rooms are large and clean with modern facilities and I couldn't fault them really. The restaurant looked nice although I never ate in it (there are a number of low cost alternatives within walking distance). There is internet in the room if you need it and tea/coffee etc as you would expect.
reviews.title: Great Hotel & Location !!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So overall it's a nice hotel with good facilities in a location that seems convenenient durng daylight hours but is more difficultt o get to at night. If I was staying in cardiff again I would book earlier and get a hotel in the centre for this reason alone.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we went to see madonna open her world tour in Cardiff last weekend. We booked the Future inn after seeing the reviews here on TA and we were very pleased that we did.
reviews.title: A brilliant hotel

reviews.text: myself and my son are Disabled and always stay in a twin disabled room, the room is very spacious and has a wonderful walk in shower ideal for people like myself with mobility issues. The staff are wonderful and always very helpful and as we have stayed on a number of occasions they always greet you with a warm welcome when you return, and nothing seems to much trouble for them to help you in any way. We always eat in the Monkey Tree Restaurant opposite the Hotel as i am on a small budget being a single parent, the food in The Monkey Tree is excellent value for money and you never leave feeling hungry and they have a very good choice of menu. And there is also a Pizza Hut close by if you have people with you who enjoy pizza, you should also visit the Red Dragon Centre about a 10 min walk from the Hotel it has lots going on for the whole family. There is bowling alleys, odeon cinema, Doctor Who exhibition and lots of restaurants serving, Mexican, Italian, Indian and American food. I would give Future Inn Cardiff 10/ 10 and will be returning again soon. Julie Hannah (disabled single parent)
reviews.title: its our second home

likes.liked: — the spacious room for disabled guests
likes.disliked: — the TV could be a little bigger as i have poor eye sight

reviews.title: loved the view
reviews.text: A well situated hotel for Cardiff Bay but an unpleasant walk across car parks to get there.The hotel had the ambience ,however of a Travel Lodge but the food in the restaurant was very pleasant. I asked for a room near the lift but it was that far along the corridor it was almost in Newport. but it had a splendid view of the roundabout which in fact wew quite enjoyed-maybe we should get a life .Overall it was good value comfortable accomodation for Cardiff bay with good links to Central Cardiff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for a one night bed and breakfast stay on a Friday evening.
reviews.title: Great Budget PriceHotel in Cardiff

likes.liked: — Comfortable bed and good sized room
likes.disliked: — Yes the hotel is a little out of the way but is fine if public transport/taxis are used if you cannot walk a distance

reviews.text: Location. Yes it is out of the way but your sat nav should get you there with the postcode. The Future Inns sign is prominent on the building as you approach and there is a sign on the road to direct you pass the Pizza Hut and Monkey (sorry cannot remember the full name but we did have lunch there which was good value). Parking is plentiful around the building.
reviews.title: Very Good Value

reviews.text: Reception. So many people on reception meant we were looked after straight away. Room was ready as well and details of our stay confirmed. Room as on fifth floor and lift was large and available.
reviews.title: nice, clean hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at the Future Inn for one night on business in July.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was massive, and spotless. I had two doubles in mine even though I was the only one staying there!
reviews.title: Good Hotel, nothing amazing, but good enough

reviews.text: Entertainment system was good and a nice suprise, free internet in the room is very limited though, although the wi-fi in bar and reception was very handy.
reviews.title: Fabulous value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was delicious but was a bit on the cold side which was a shame. Check in and check out both swift and hassle-free, and the easy (and free) car-parking is a big bonus.
reviews.title: Great value for money, and great location for Cardiff Bay

reviews.text: It's position is a bit weird, but this hotel, although lacking in character, is good for short breaks when you're more likely to spend time outside of the hotel.
reviews.title: Good location nice and comfortable

reviews.text: We stayed for three nights in March 2012 while visiting family. All we wanted was a bed and breakfast and we chose the Future Inn because it offered a really good price, for what looked like a clean hotel. It lived up to that expectation. The location is only a few minutes walk from the Cardiff Bay waterfront development and easy to park. The hotel was clean and modern; the staff were all friendly and efficient. The breakfast ingredients were a bit basic, but for £6 for an English breakfast you cannot complain. The room was spacious and well furnished. If I were to be picky, I might redesign some of the clothes storage furniture, but that is minor. We would stay there again.
reviews.title: Good place for visiting Cardiff

reviews.text: The room is clean and large for a single. There is a bath as well as shower facility. Toilet freshness needs to be improved upon. The extractor is working flat out without removing the smell.I can't hear my neighbours and the noise level is generally low. Breakfast buffet is excellent The room price can vary by over a 100 pounds between weeks, without any explanation. When I asked to see the manager, I was told she was on a course and apparently so was everyone else who might explain their pricing policy. Its very convenient for the Cardiff bay area. Internet access via the keypad provided is a joke. Didn't have my laptop with me to try it. The fitness centre was unavailable and i didn't get a satisfactory explanation. Overall - I would say its better than the bottom end of the market and would recommend it - if you can live with the issues mentioned.
reviews.title: convenient and satisfactory - but could do better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was lovely, room was very big and food was hot and value for money.
reviews.title: Very convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is in a great location close to Cardiff bay and the arena.
reviews.title: Convenient, comfortable, with a great location

reviews.text: We stayed on the 4th March in suite 501/502. Amazing price for a spacious set of rooms. We loved the seating area, when we watched the France V Ireland game. The free parking is always a bonus, the welcome very friendly and the check in speedy. The suite was clean and tidy, just the tiny issue of a handle missing off the TV cabinet in the bedroom area, however I think the fact that is all we picked up on proves what a pleasant stay it was. The bed was HUGE and very comfortable, and despite the busy road network in the area the room was very quiet. The bathroom was well kept. The location was perfect for us attending a concert at the WMC, only a 10 minute walk away. We used the bar on our return to the hotel, and were warmly welcomed by the bar staff. Breakfast, great buffet selection, and the waiter again was very welcoming. If you are looking for a hotel with great room rates in the Bay area, you would not go wrong with Future Inn. We'll be back!
reviews.title: Great family suite, close to all Cardiff Bay attractions

reviews.text: We stayed as a family of four. We had two big double beds which was perfect the room was lovely, spacious and spotlessly clean. The price was very reasonable. The location was ideal - right by loads of restaurants, and a short walk (even for a three and four year old) to a little train station to catch a train into the middle of Cardiff. This was an excellent trip and I have very fond memories.
reviews.title: lovely hotel

reviews.text: Stayed at the future Inn Cardiff for 2 nights because my daughter was at a swimming competition. It was ideal for what I wanted as the hotel was only 10 mins from the gala itself. Also the Red Dragon Centre was across the car park so took the kids for a bite to eat and bowling and had a glass of wine or two as I did not have to drive back to the hotel.
reviews.title: Ideal location

reviews.text: The hotel room was spacious and clean and had a great breakfast in the morning which was help yourself. Staff were very helpful and all in all had a great couple of nights here. Will definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Good Family Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a good deal at this hotel where my two teenage children and I children stayed in a large suite which easily accommodated the three of us. For the price it was a large space. I slept on the fold-out couch - which was tolerable for one, maybe two would be a struggle.
reviews.title: Decent Hotel, Ok Service

reviews.text: Otherwise the hotel is typical mid-range fare. Average fit-out, with slightly above average staff. I chose it, partly for the free parking - which is not secured and partly for the free wifi - which is only in the lobby.
reviews.title: Affordable, spacious rooms in good location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great value for money. Had two double beds in our room and only booked a double room. Very clean with modern decor.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a convenient location

reviews.text: Next to a leisure park near the bay front in Cardiff, it has a great location. Free car park, but there was a slight noise from the traffic outside. Breakfast and evening meals were to a good standard. Staff excellent and sorted a minor problem quickly. Only down side was that the Wi Fi was not throughout and the cable access in the room was terminally slow (according to my teenagers).
reviews.title: Overall a good standard for a budget

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Your average budget hotel

reviews.text: From the website I was expecting something slightly nicer than your usual budget hotel but it's not anything special, it is your average budget hotel but still good value for money.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: The rooms are really spacious, there's free parking, Cardiff city centre is a walk able distance (about 20minutes) and the Bay with a nice selection of bars and restaurants is about a 5 minute walk. The hotel is on a complex with restaurants, a cinema and bowling so there's plenty to do if you want to stay closer to home.
reviews.title: Good hotel at good rates!

aka: Future Inn Cardiff Bay Hotel Cardiff
